reviewText: Great As Usual. I Got Most Of These  From The Marketplace And Some At The Ridiculous Price Of .99 Cents. All Brand New. Best Dvd Deals Ever!!

In volume 3, the quality of animation and level of relatively competent story-telling remains consistent with the first two volumes. The action, however, is a bit more subdued. Tetsujin takes a back seat as the boy detective solves "human" mysteries and uses the gigantic robot only as a last resort. Where are the huge robot on robot battles? It's a bit disappointing, particularly since this is the first volume with only 4 episodes... as opposed to the 5 (on volumes 1 and 2).
